column4: but i think it may have to do with my attempt at installing KDE4
hmm:well i tried using gparted, made a separate partition, loaded the ISO onto that via ubuntu.com instructions, and i still get errors.
but i don't understand how both my drives can get effed up from ubuntu/KDE4
do you have a copy of Windows?
would, but i can't. my burner isn't operational in ubuntu for some reason. I had accidentally upgraded to Hardy (don't ask how, somehow the repository got added to my sources.list)
DAMN kde4. well like i said, i've tried booting from a separate partition, and i get errors from that and from the CD. Any ideas on how to do a reinstall?
Haha yeah, i'm on my messed up system right now
yeah, should i try burning the alternate CD and see if that works?
try this, start up your CD, and then click install, but instead of installing, click "check CD for errors"
already tried that, reported no errors
yeah, that kinda bites. The problem isn't my HDD's though, it's my optical drives. I can't boot from ANY disks. I tried a mandriva disk, didn't work.
Unfortunately no, not a legal one.
I thought the same thing, reset my bios to the defaults, still had the same problems.
It's a possibility, i get grub errors semi-frequently
final consensus, windows semi loads, then does nothing
